homepage.gps: any device with a GPS reciever will do!
homepage.whatItIs: is a worldwide treasure hunting game
homepage.notes: Moving the videos to YouTube meant I had to remove a feature - notes. You were able to write down notes with the built-in player.
homepage.notebut: Videos had a button to write notes!
homepage.a11: They do what I want them to do
homepage.q1: What leads you to use uncommon software?
homepage.q2: Does LMMS have MIDI interface support for el. instruments?
homepage.q3: How much is the web hosting?
homepage.q4: How long have you been playing Geocaching?
homepage.info: The Website, Game and Videos were made in 2023-24! I presented this project on May 20th, 2024 at SPSVOS Sokolska in Brno.
homepage.presenting: After presenting the project, I left the site intact, but I wanted to save space on my servers. Videos were moved to YouTube and the game to Newgrounds!

video.help: You can write them under videos.
video.videoDesc3: There are tons of different kinds of caches and they're not just divided into how big they are or what's inside of them, but into tons of other categories!
video.videoDesc4: Today, we find a real cache out in the wild' Finally you'll witness first-hand, how a cache can look like, where it can be found and what's on the inside.
video.videoDesc6:
You can find all sorts of stuff inside a cache! One of those things can be a travel bug. What is it? What to do with it? You'll find out today!

You can activate a travel bug here.
video.videoDesc2:
Now we know what a cache is, but we don't know how or with what to find it! We'll figure that out today.

To download one of the mentioned applications, you can use these links.
Official Geocaching App
Android: Download
iOS: Download

c:geo
Android: Download
video.videoDesc5:
Geocaching has been a thing for a while now! In this video, we'll touch upon how the game started, what the first cache was and how Geocaching became so popular. We'll even talk out about how well it did in the Czech Republic!

The cache on Charles Bridge
video.videoDesc7:
Every community has their own acronyms and Geocaching is no slouch in that regard. We'll mention some of them today and how useful they are when logging or making threads on forums!

Bonus:
Here are two exact opposited. Something like fire and water, or yin and yang!
  • cacher - anyone who's looking for caches
  • muggle - a passerby, who doesn't know about Geocaching
video.videoDesc1:
This is the first from a series of videos, where we'll talk about the basics of Geocaching. In this video, you'll learn what a cache is, where to find one and what you need for it.

A Geocaching account can be made here.

Here's a map of caches near you.
video.videoDesc8:
Not only are cachers controversial, because the pry their eyes into places they're not supposed to, but they're also get laughed at, because of how they fail badly at being inconspicuous.

The Article: https://necyklopedie.org/wiki/Geocaching

nast.noLocalStorage: The Planner needs local storage/cookies to work.
nast.dropHelp: They will get added to this section.
nast.dia2: The Planner can be used to organize your downloaded caches. You can also view your caches on a map.
nast.dia4:
Caches are loaded from .gpx files downloaded from Geocaching.com. You can add files by pressing the "Add caches button" or by dragging them into the browser. Data is saved locally in the browser, meaning they aren't sent anywhere.
You can drag caches to any spot or move them between sections. By holding the CTRL key, you can select multiple caches at once.
nast.dia6: Saved caches will get lost when deleting cookies or storage in the browser. Before removing them, you should backup your data by exporting it. Import them to load them back. You can also import caches in different browsers or even devices. Before importing, you can select the method of merging.
nast.name: Name
nast.notACache: One of the files is not a cache!

game.krabkaLongDesc:
Your goal is to protect the cache from hoards of enemies. You can do it by:
  • Clicking the logbook - that will gift you points
  • Use the points to buy towers, clickers and upgrades
  • Place towers in the field to make them shoot enemies!
game.krabkaDesc: Can you save your cache from hoards of enemies?
